simple.util

Class BlockingDeque<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.util.BlockingDeque<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>, java.util.concurrent.BlockingDeque<E>, java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<E>, java.util.Deque<E>, java.util.Queue<E>

    public class BlockingDeque<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.concurrent.BlockingDeque<E>
    Blocks until the list has an item.
    Created: Feb 8, 2010
    Author:
    Kenneth Pierce

        public boolean offer(E e,
                     long timeout,
                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Attempts to add e to the queue. Will wait the specified time if the queue is full.
        Specified by:
        offer in interface java.util.concurrent.BlockingDeque<E>
        Specified by:
        offer in interface java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<E>
        Parameters:
        e - Element to add.
        timeout - Length of time to wait.
        unit - Units of time to wait.
        Returns:

        java.lang.NullPointerException - if e is null
